folder: Columbia Heights & Orange Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
106-112 Columbia Heights, west side, north of Orange Street, showing the center house (No. 110) in which Col. Washington A. Roebling lived. It was from the rear room on the second floor that he watched and directed the construction of the Brooklyn Bridge, being ably assisted in this work by his wife.

1922.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
title: Brooklyn: Columbia Heights - Orange Street

folder: Columbia Heights & Orange Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
Columbia Heights, north from Orange to Fulton Streets; showing a portion of the Brooklyn Bridge in the background. (The tall building in the
center is the Hotel Margaret).
1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
title: Brooklyn: Columbia Heights - Orange Street

folder: Columbia Heights & Orange Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
Columbia Heights, west side, south from Orange Street.
1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
title: Brooklyn: Columbia Heights - Orange Street

text:
A general view northwest from the Hotel Margaret, which is located at the N.E. corner of Columbia Heights and Orange Street. This view shows from fore to background a section of Brooklyn Heights, the East River, the Brooklyn Bridge and the Manhattan sky and shoreline. In the foreground is the west side of Columbia Heights from Cranberry to Fulton Streets.

1926.

Brown Brothers.
title: General View - Columbia Heights - Brooklyn.
